traceability.evidence: - All 164 Vitest tests passed, including 4 tests in test/cli.format-json.test.js, 1 in test/cli.format-json.error.test.js, 1 in test/json-formatter.test.js, and 1 in test/printOutdated.json.test.js - CLI accepts --format=json (parseOptions, parseFormatFlag) - jsonFormatter and handleJsonOutput produce valid, parseable JSON with timestamp, packages array, summary and thresholds - JSON output includes complete package data (name, current, wanted, latest, recommended, age, vulnerabilities, filtered, filterReason, type) - Summary contains totalOutdated, safeUpdates, filteredByAge, filteredBySecurity, thresholds - Exit codes for JSON mode: 0 (no updates), 1 (updates available via --check), 2 (errors) verified by tests - Console noise suppressed (stderr empty) in JSON mode - Default behavior remains table output when no --format specified (functional tests) - Help text includes --format option (bin/dry-aged-deps.js)
traceability.notes: The implementation fully satisfies the JSON output story (prompts/008.0-DEV-JSON-OUTPUT.md). All acceptance criteria are met, and traceability is present in code comments and tests reference the story. JSON output is valid, complete, and behaves correctly in success, filter, and error scenarios.
